sen.j: 高岡 泰重（たかおか やすしげ、生没年未詳）は、鎌倉時代の常陸国の武士。
sen.e: Yasushige TAKAOKA (高岡 泰重, the dates of birth and death unknown) was a Bushi (samurai) in Hitachi Province in the Kamakura period.
Yasushige TAKAOKA (高岡 泰重, year of birth and death unknown) was a Bushi (samurai) in Hitachi Province in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 規定に従い、書き換えました。
sen.e: Yasushige TAKAOKA (高岡 泰重, year of birth and death unknown) was a Bushi (samurai) in Hitachi Province in the Kamakura period.
He was the founder of the Takaoka clan of Hitachi Province.
He was the founder of the Takaoka clan of Hitachi Province.
He was the founder of the Takaoka clan of Hitachi Province.
He was the fifth son of the Oda clan.
He was the fifth son of the Oda clan.
He was the fifth son of the Oda clan.
(A grandchild of Tomoie HATTA).
(A grandchild of Tomoie HATTA).
(A grandchild of Tomoie HATTA).
He was a younger brother of Yasutomo ODA.
He was a younger brother of Yasutomo ODA.
He was a younger brother of Yasutomo ODA.
He called himself Rokuro TAKAOKA.
He called himself Rokuro TAKAOKA.
He called himself Rokuro TAKAOKA.
His official court rank was Saemon no jo (third-ranked officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards).
His official court rank was Saemon no jo (third-ranked officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards).
His official court rank was Saemon no jo (third-ranked officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards).

sen.j: 常陸国筑波郡高岡郷を領して高岡氏を称したという。
sen.e: It is said that he gained Takaoka-go (village), Tsukuba County, Hitachi Province as his territory, and so he called himself Takaoka clan.
It is said that he gained Takaoka-go (village), Tsukuba County, Hitachi Province as his territory, and so he called himself Takaoka clan.
It is said that he gained Takaoka-go (village), Tsukuba County, Hitachi Province as his territory, and so he called himself Takaoka clan.

sen.j: 現地には高岡城跡も存在するが、原形が崩れて判別し難い。
sen.e: There are still the remains of Takaoka-jo Castle in the spot, but the original form has collapsed so extremely to recognize.
There are still the remains of Takaoka-jo Castle in the spot, but it has extremely lost its original form and we cannot even recognize.
sen.cmt: 分かりやすいように書き換えました。
sen.e: There are still the remains of Takaoka-jo Castle in the spot, but it has extremely lost its original form and we cannot even recognize.
